title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 using the pages router, TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to provide a feature-rich development dashboard. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, showcasing best practices for structuring robust applications with modern web technologies. This repository serves as a comprehensive example of a modern web application architecture.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with Robofleet data. This project provides a user-friendly dashboard to monitor robot fleets, analyze data streams, and control robot operations, making it a central tool for managing and understanding robotic systems within a Robofleet environment.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: This repository hosts a simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) expense tracker application built using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It provides a user-friendly interface for managing personal expenses, leveraging Material-UI for a clean and responsive design. The project demonstrates fundamental web development principles and serves as a practical example for learning or implementing similar CRUD functionalities.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript that explores [mention the project's main purpose if known from the README, e.g., "modern web application development", "a note-taking application", or "a data visualization dashboard"]. It serves as a playground for experimenting with best practices in [mention key areas, e.g., "front-end architecture", "state management", or "UI design"] within the context of the defined project goals.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to serve as a customizable dashboard template. It showcases best practices for structuring a Next.js application and provides a foundation for building data-driven user interfaces, focusing on clean architecture and maintainable code for various project types.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a digital idea board to help organize and visualize project concepts. This interactive tool allows users to brainstorm, categorize, and manage their ideas, fostering collaboration and efficient project planning within a user-friendly interface.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a web-based CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, offering users a platform to create, read, update, and delete data records. Utilizing HTML and CSS for the front-end and Shell scripting for deployment and maintenance, this project serves as a practical example of a full-stack Python web application, showcasing best practices in database interaction and web development principles.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This GitHub repository, "Map-Visualisation," showcases a project focused on visualizing geographical data using HTML and Python. It allows users to create interactive maps and perform spatial analysis. The project leverages HTML for front-end presentation and Python for data processing and manipulation, demonstrating a practical application of combining these technologies for data visualization.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, written primarily in TeX for generating a clean, professional PDF document. The project also includes an HTML version for online accessibility and sharing. It serves as a practical demonstration of my skills in document preparation, typesetting, and basic web development.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-Debt-Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This application allows users to track their sleep patterns, calculate their accumulated sleep debt, and provides insights to optimize their sleep schedule. Leveraging the benefits of TypeScript for type safety and JavaScript for dynamic functionality, this project offers a user-friendly interface for understanding and addressing sleep deprivation.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Jupyter Notebooks written in Python for exploring various financial concepts and building simple financial models. Aimed at learning and practical application, the projects cover topics like stock analysis, portfolio optimization, and potentially other quantitative finance areas. It serves as a hands-on resource for those interested in using Python to analyze and manage financial data.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application leveraging the Gemini API built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js to provide a dynamic and engaging conversational experience. The project utilizes modern web technologies like CSS, JavaScript, and HTML for a responsive front-end and offers a demonstration of integrating AI-powered interactions within a web-based platform.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern, real-time voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, JavaScript and styled with CSS. This project allows for the creation and participation in various voting scenarios, leveraging Next.js's capabilities for server-side rendering and dynamic routing, aiming for a fast and user-friendly experience.  It serves as a practical example and exploration within the "project" topic category, showcasing best practices in web development with modern technologies.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Supabase, and Tailwind CSS for tracking IoT assets. It offers a user-friendly interface for monitoring location and status data, leveraging the power of serverless architecture and component-based styling to provide a scalable and maintainable solution for asset management. The project demonstrates best practices for full-stack development using a modern JavaScript framework.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a JavaScript-based project that creates a visually appealing and interactive event calendar using HTML and CSS. This repository provides a foundation for building a customizable calendar component capable of displaying and managing events dynamically. It serves as a starting point for learning web development, front-end calendar implementations, and project organization, leveraging common web technologies for a user-friendly experience.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a dynamic web project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focused on [insert a brief, compelling description of the project's purpose based on the README or your understanding of "atg-world" - e.g., exploring interactive world maps, visualizing global data, or simulating a virtual world]. This repository showcases modern web development techniques and aims to [mention the project's main goal or intended user benefit - e.g., provide an engaging user experience, offer a powerful data exploration tool, or demonstrate specific interactive capabilities].

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for efficiently analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and visualizing log data to aid in debugging and understanding ROS system behavior. This project covers topics in robotics and software development, aiming to simplify the process of ROS log analysis for developers.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 utilizing the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching. This repository showcases a modern approach to online shopping experiences, leveraging MUI for a clean and responsive UI, and emphasizes strong typing for maintainability and scalability. It serves as a practical example of building a complete e-commerce application with industry-standard technologies and best practices.
